beforeVariables.name: monster
beforeVariables.meaning: Name / Name of the monster that spawned

beforeVariables.name: killed
beforeVariables.meaning: Time when the monster will spawn. For example, if you have notify in 15 minutes, then killed will be equal to the current time + 15 minutes

beforeVariables.name: before
beforeVariables.meaning: The time for which you need to notify the user. Configurable in group / user settings. For example, 5 minutes, in 10 minutes

beforeVariables.name: missed
beforeVariables.meaning: How many times the monster was missed

spanVariables.name: monster
spanVariables.meaning: Name / Name of the monster that spawned

spanVariables.name: killed
spanVariables.meaning: Time when the monster will spawn next time. For example, if the monster spawned now, and his recharge is 2 hours, then killed will be equal to the current time + 2 hours

spanVariables.name: missed
spanVariables.meaning: How many times the monster was missed

notificationTemplates.inputBodyPlaceholder: Enter the body of the notification
notificationTemplates.description:
You can make your own notice template. To do this, use "variables"
 during the submission process, the variables in the template will be replaced with values. Note,
 that for different templates the variables may differ logically

datetime.example:
Sun, Mon, …, Sat (en_US);
So, Mo, …, Sa (de_DE)

datetime.meaning: Day of the month as a zero-padded decimal number

datetime.example:
Jan, Feb, …, Dec (en_US);
Jan, Feb, …, Dez (de_DE)

datetime.meaning: Month as a zero-padded decimal number.
Year without century as a zero-padded decimal number.
Year with century as a decimal number.
Hour (24-hour clock) as a zero-padded decimal number.
Minute as a zero-padded decimal number.
Second as a zero-padded decimal number.
Microsecond as a decimal number, zero-padded to 6 digits.

disablePremiumInfoModal.title: Ability to disable premium
disablePremiumInfoModal.description: This function is a loyalty system for the user. By purchasing a premium with this option, you can temporarily 'freeze' the use of the primum. For example, if you do not use the timer for some At that time, using the 'Disable temporarily' option you can stop using the premium. You can enable the premium later. Please note that the ability to temporarily disable the premium is limited.

scopes.TimersHistory.View: Viewing the history of group timers
scopes.TimersHistory.Restore: Restoring from the history of group timers
scopes.GroupRoles.Change: Ability to change roles in a group
scopes.EventMobileNotifications: Notifications in a mobile application for timers

commonInfo.title: General information
commonInfo.block_1: This section describes all types of premium access. Each premium includes from one to several access , with a description of which can be found below.
commonInfo.block_2: After connection, your account will have premium access specified in your premium. You can also connect several premium accounts. In this case, the accesses will be summed up from different premiums. You can see the number of all current accesses in your profile in the section <0>Premium Access</0>. You can renew, stop temporarily, view premiums in the section <1>My premiums</1>.

premiumAccesses.block_1: The column "Limited"indicates the setting of a limit for this access.
premiumAccesses.block_2: If access is limited, then the number of entities created under this access is limited by a limit. For example, the limit is set on the creation of groups, which limits the number of created/used groups
premiumAccesses.block_3: If dos stupid is not limited, the data access can be used as many times as you want and is not limited by the number of entities

premEnded.title: What will happen when the premium ends?
premEnded.block_1: Each premium is issued for some then a certain time. For example, for 30 days. An exception is the free premium, which is issued for all new accounts.
premEnded.block_2: Upon expiration of the premium, timers/groups/group timers will be disabled. But they will not be deleted. When you renew the premium, all your timers/groups/group timers will be restored and you can use them.
premEnded.block_3: To avoid disconnecting timers/groups/group timers, it is recommended to renew the premium in advance

notificationsIntegrations.example: For example 7 - means the notification will be in 7 minutes

comments.title: Timer comments
comments.description: In this section, you can customize templates for comments to timers. Then these templates will appear in the field for quick comment selection.

statuses.WAITING_tooltip: Premium is awaiting payment. If payment has been made, please wait for our service to receive this information. It usually takes about 5 minutes
statuses.PAID_tooltip: Payment has been successfully received. The privileges will become available when the premium goes into the "Active" state
statuses.ACTIVE_tooltip: Premium is active, all premium accesses are enabled
statuses.EXPIRED_tooltip: Payment due date has expired. All payments are issued for one year
statuses.DISABLED_tooltip: Premium disabled due to expiration of usage time
statuses.DISABLED_TEMPORARILY_tooltip: Premium is temporarily disabled, you can resume it at any time
statuses.WAITING_FOR_EXTEND_tooltip: Premium is awaiting payment. If payment has been made, please wait for our service to receive this information. It usually takes about 5 minutes.

disablePremiumModal.title: Temporarily disable premium?
disablePremiumModal.description: This premium has the option of being temporarily disabled. The number of disconnected times is limited. You can resume your premium later.

premiumAccesses.description: In this section, you can see the total number of premium access and the number of consumed access. Please note that such accesses as receiving notifications, history, roles are multiplied, but do not give great advantages.

vk.title: Receive notifications via Vkontakte
vk.description: Enter your Vkontakte ID. The ID can be found in the link to your personal profile. Click save, then go to the <0> dialogue </0> with the <1> RQ Timer </1> group and write any message. After that, you will receive a notification via Vkontakte.
vk.qrDescription: You can go into dialogue with the RQ Timer group. Scan the QR code below

telegram.title: Receiving notifications via Telegram
telegram.description: Enter your Telegram username (@my_name, @username). Click save, then go to the bot and write to it or press /start. After that, the bot will send you notifications.
telegram.qrDescription: You can find our Telegram bot using a QR code. Scan the QR code below

welcome.title: Welcome to RQ Timer
welcome.description: Broad functionality. Create private timers if you are playing alone. Or a group for your guildmates and friends. Use integrations to receive notifications. Enjoy your game :)
